title: Reconstruction of congenital microtia after ear canaloplasty using V-Y advancement of a temporal triangular flap
patient: A 10-year-old boy presented with bilateral lobule-type microtia (). He underwent canaloplasty on his right ear 4 years prior to auricular reconstruction. The ear was reconstructed using a V-Y advancement flap with a concurrent rib cartilage graft in the first stage. Immediate postoperative views showed good convolution despite soft tissue deficiency.
